meanings.sent1: After the sun set, the air around us cooled quickly.
meanings.sent2: I put the hot soup in the fridge to let it cool down.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was so cold that it actually cooled my tongue!
meanings.sent4: As the evening breeze cooled the room, I felt more relaxed.
meanings.sent5: The iced tea was so refreshing, it felt like a wave of coolness had cooled my whole body.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become cooler.
meanings.sent1: She cooled the room by opening the windows on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The fan cooled the overheated computer quickly.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally cooled his coffee by leaving it on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The rain shower cooled the scorching pavement, creating steam.
meanings.sent5: The ice pack cooled the burn on her arm, providing relief.

meanings.sent1: The cup of tea cooled as she forgot about it while reading.
meanings.sent2: The metal rod cooled rapidly after being taken out of the fire.
meanings.sent3: The hot chocolate cooled too much, so she had to warm it up again.
meanings.sent4: The engine cooled down slowly after a long drive.
meanings.sent5: The warm pie cooled on the windowsill, tempting everyone with its delicious scent.
